means: 英尺(=12 英寸或 30.48 厘米)

sentence.Network_en: The ball fell straight to the feet of Klinsmann.
sentence.Network_cn: 球直接落到了克林斯曼的脚上。

sentence.Network_en: I've gotten my feet thoroughly soaked and feel frozen through and through.
sentence.Network_cn: 我双脚湿透，感觉都冻到骨头里了。

sentence.Network_en: You should wash your feet and your privates every day.
sentence.Network_cn: 应该每天洗脚，并清洗阴部。

encyclopedia.content: foot的复数 n. 1. 脚，足[C] 2. 锛埑ね嗟鹊娘級足部[S1] 3. 步态[U] 4. 最下部，底部[the S][(+of)] The village is at the foot of the mountain. 村子在山脚下。 5. 英尺[C] The building is 60 feet high. 这幢房子有六十尺高。 6. 锛埵娘級音步[C] 7. 【英】锛堊艹骑級步兵[K] vt. 1. 步行，走[+it] We're footing it instead of riding. 我们以步代车。 The children footed the whole ten miles. 孩子们步行了足

entry.def: Feet is the plural of foot .

auth_sentence.content: Some took to their feet and pumped their fists.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some took to their feet and pumped their fists.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some took to their feet and pumped their fists.

auth_sentence.content: They have stout, longish bills and webbed feet.
auth_sentence.res_content: They have stout, longish bills and webbed feet.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They have stout, longish bills and webbed feet.

auth_sentence.content: On water they can use their feet as brakes.
auth_sentence.res_content: On water they can use their feet as brakes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On water they can use their feet as brakes.

Sentence.sentence: Altitude sickness usually begins when a climber goes above 8000 or 9000 feet.
I had it down by my feet between me and the man in the next seat.
The West Antarctic ice sheet was about 7,000 feet thick.

means.word_mean: 拜倒在某人脚下；对…倾倒拜服

sentences.en: As a young man, he had the whole of Paris at his feet.
sentences.cn: 他年纪轻轻，征服了整个巴黎。

sentences.en: In the last few days before Christmas, the sales assistants were rushed off their feet.
sentences.cn: 圣诞节前几天，售货员们忙得不可开交。

means.word_mean: 安然摆脱困境；化险为夷；运气好

sentences.en: Well, you really fell on your feet this time, didn’t you? A job in Rome, a large flat, a company car …
sentences.cn: 哈，你这次真是交了好运，不是吗？到罗马工作，有所大公寓，还有公司配的车?

sentences.en: If you want me to leave this house, you’ll have to carry me out feet first.
sentences.cn: 要想让我离开这所房子，你先把我杀了吧。

means.word_mean: (受景仰受尊敬的人)品格上的缺陷(或弱点)

sentences.en: Why are people always surprised when they discover that their heroes have feet of clay?
sentences.cn: 为什么人们发现他们心目中的英雄也有弱点时总是那么吃惊呢？

sentences.en: He is always talking about his big plans to be a great actor. You should tell him to keep his feet on the ground.
sentences.cn: 他总是谈论自己要当大明星的远大计划，你应该告诉他要脚踏实地。

sentences.en: Being a shop assistant means that you’re on your feet all day long.
sentences.cn: 当店员就意味着你得整天站着。

sentences.en: Only our party’s policies will really get the country on its feet again.
sentences.cn: 只有我党的政策才能真正使国家恢复繁荣。

sentences.en: The company seems to be back on its feet now.
sentences.cn: 这家公司似乎重新站住了脚。

sentences.en: After work, I like to have a cup of tea and put my feet up.
sentences.cn: 下班以后，我喜欢喝杯茶放松放松。

sentences.en: You’ve worked for this company for 35 years, Jack. Now it’s time for you to put your feet up and relax.
sentences.cn: 杰克，你为这家公司辛苦了35年，现在该休息一下了。

means.word_mean: 挡某人的道；妨碍某人工作

sentences.en: It’s difficult to do housework with the children under my feet all the time.
sentences.cn: 有孩子在身边缠着，我很难做家务事。
